items.text: Comets are like cosmic snowballs, made of ice and dust, and they shine brightly when they get close to the sun!
Asteroids are rocky remnants from the early solar system, and they can be found hanging out in the asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter!
Some comets take hundreds of years to complete their journey around the sun, making them rare visitors to our night sky!
